headline: ConocoPhillips Cost Cuts And Alaska Union Drive Test Investor Confidence
summary: ConocoPhillips plans to cut $1 billion in capital and operating costs in 2026, including a 20% to 25% workforce reduction at its Alaska operations next year. Roughly 250 North Slope oil field workers have voted to unionize in response, citing concerns about job security, safety, wages, and benefits. The new union is preparing for negotiations with ConocoPhillips that could influence labor costs, operating practices, and the company’s role in local communities. For investors watching...
